title: Authorizes a real property tax exemption for senior citizens in the town of Southampton
summary: Authorizes a real property tax exemption for senior citizens in the town of Southampton equal to the exemption amount under the enhanced STAR program.

   28  FILE  SHALL  BE PREPARED IN SUCH FORM AND MANNER AS MAY BE PRESCRIBED BY

   30    5. CORRECTION OF AN INCORRECT ENTRY. AN INCORRECT ENTRY ON AN  ASSESS-
   31  MENT  ROLL  OF  A TOWN OF SOUTHAMPTON REAL PROPERTY TAX EXEMPTION MAY BE

   34  TWENTY-FIVE OF THIS TITLE. A DENIAL OF A TOWN OF SOUTHAMPTON REAL  PROP-

   37    6. INCONSISTENT LAWS SUPERSEDED. THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION  SHALL

   39    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

BILL NUMBER:S1859

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the real property tax law, in relation to providing a real
property tax exemption for the senior citizens in the town of
Southampton

PURPOSE:
Upon the adoption of a local law, this bill would provide an
additional tax abatement to senior citizens in the town of
Southampton, in addition to the STAR program. The abatement would be
based on reassessment value of the property with the assessment roll
completed in 2006 and through 2021.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
In the town of Southampton, county of Suffolk, the property of a
senior citizen that qualifies for and received the enhanced exemption
pursuant to subdivision 4 of section 425 of the real property tax law
shall be eligible for abatement. There will be no separate
application required for the abatement. Eligibility for abatement
will be determined annually by the town assessor.
The abatement will eliminate all tax that results from any increase in
the town tax applicable to the assessment roll. However, it will not
limit tax increases if the actual value of the property increases.

JUSTIFICATION:
The Town of Southampton is undertaking a town-wide reassessment that
would bring all properties up to 100% market value thereby obviating
the need to utilize the State's equalization rate. The Town of
Southampton would like to ensure that its' senior citizen population,
who are on fixed income, do not suffer any adverse affects from
reassessment. This amendment would provide that senior citizens who
qualify for the enhanced STAR exemption would also receive the
appropriate partial tax abatement on their Town portion of the tax
bill. This amendment would not limit tax increases resulting from an
actual change in the value of property or from subsequent town tax
rate increases for tax rate increases for taxes other than the town
tax.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2009-10: S.3648A
2007-08: S.658-B
2005-06: S.1839-A
2003-04: S.6323

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
